title: examines the papacy’s view of its relationship with rulers, including the doctrines of the ‘two powers’ and the ‘two swords’. The Roman influence on barbarian kings, and the Christian influence on Byzantine emperors, are important themes of Lee
The most full-blooded case for pagan beliefs underlying royal power even after conversion to Christianity is made by Chaney
but there is a classic, succinct discussion by Binchy
The importance of Rome to the ideology of barbarian kings is set out by Wormald
